Message.Title: JP Morgan Tech Conference at CES - Nvidia Presents Jan 8th at 11:30 AM ET
Message.Msg: Tech Forum at CES Jan 8, 2013 Las Vegas, NV Bellagio Hotel Print J.P. Morgan is hosting the 11th Annual Tech Forum at CES 2013, taking place on January 8, 2013 at the Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas. The principal aim of the event is to present an additional corporate access opportunity to J.P. Morgan's key clients attending the Consumer Electronics Show. Please contact your J.P. Morgan representative for more information and/or to request an invitation. Please remember that all J.P. Morgan conferences are by invitation only. Invitations are non-transferable. he following companies are confirmed to present at the conference: Avago Technologies Limited Cypress Semiconductor Dell Inc. IntelCorporation Marvell Technology Group ltd. Micron Technology Inc. Microsoft NVDIA Corporation NXP Semiconductors ON Semiconductor Corp. Tech Data Corporation Texas Instruments Xilinx

Topic.Title: JP Morgan Tech Conference at CES - Nvidia Presents Jan 8th at 11:30 AM ET

Message.Msg: QUALCOMM would have liked to be at JPM's chicken and peas event too. But their folks are too busy writing Snapdragon orders over at the main Show. And besides, since King Paul Jacobs gave the Opening Keynote Address, there's no point in proclaiming the same things twice.

Message.Msg: Probably THE most important video of the year. Yes boys, the Best. King Paul Jacobs, the Chairman of QUALCOMM, pronounces where they will take mobile technology in the future. Tell Jen to watch too, okay? He's not doing Any of the stuff that QUALCOMM is working on. Google the King's message, boys : Qualcomm CEO Jacobs on Mobile Technology: Video - Bloomberg "We integrate more things in a single piece of silicon than anyone on the planet." "Next up : Human brain neurons -- integrated in silicon"

Topic.Title: JP Morgan Tech Conference at CES - Nvidia Presents Jan 8th at 11:30 AM ET

Message.Msg: It just may happen...After all this is a conference for Wall Street whales. Huge net worth required for attendence! "Mr. Huang can you tell us how aggressive you have been and will be on your recently announced share buyback extension" "Sure....We have been active in the market and will be throughout 2013" "OK...How about the dividend." "As you know we recently introduced a $0.075 per quarter dividend. This was new to us but so far the share holder base have applauded that action. We intend to be very aggressive in increasing the dividend. With a payout ratio of only 19.2% and ever increasing cash flow we have plenty of headroom for further increases. Dividend increases will be evaluated every quarter" Love the dividend....Don't you?

Message.Title: Ashraf Eassa on SeekingAlpha -- Qualcomm: Aggressively Buy Dips
Message.Msg: Google it, boys -- SeekingAlpha Qualcomm: Aggressively Buy Dips In excerpts. "I have been bullish on shares of Qualcomm (QCOM) for the last six months. The company is an absolute mobile powerhouse and the fundamentals just keep getting better. Record sales, record profits, and a comfortable lead in all things mobile. The management team continues to execute flawlessly, supply constraints at Taiwan Semiconductor (TSM) are more or less solved, and patent licensing continues to fund the firm's forays into new areas." Unlike competitors... Nvidia (NVDA), Qualcomm OWNS all of its own IP blocks with respect to smartphone/mobile technology. Competitive Advantage: If all of your competitors (like nvidia) are all using the same building blocks, then what's to differentiate the products? Qualcomm can potentially target its custom designs at exactly what its customers need, which has ultimately led to better products than the competition. Almost every modern smartphone today comes packed with Qualcomm's technology. Notable examples include: Nokia (NOK) Lumia 920 Each and Every Windows Phone 8 device on the planet Samsung Galaxy S III Google Nexus 4 In addition, it is rumored that Research In Motion's (RIMM) upcoming BlackBerry 10 devices will be powered by Qualcomm's Snapdragon S4. According to popular smartphone performance tests, the Qualcomm "Krait" and "Adreno" CPU and graphics designs respectively also top the charts when it comes to energy-efficient performance. Licensing, Licensing: Where The Real Money Is Made! About 70% of Qualcomm's earnings before taxes comes directly from patent licensing. As more and more devices use these wireless technologies (and they certainly will as the world continues to go mobile/wireless), Qualcomm gets more and more fairly easy profit. This profit then goes and funds the development of things such as the mobile SoCs which will help to significantly grow top and bottom line growth over time. What a beautiful business model indeed! Additional disclosure: I may initiate a long position in the stock [QCOM] over the next 72 hours." "Qualcomm: Aggressively Buy Dips" Guess that means the nvda pumper boys don't like their prior hero Ashraf Eassa any more.

And "Blackie" isn't gonna cut it here. And this is a Big Big night for Jen. THE ultimate, bet-the-ranch gamble on #4. Say! Jen could call over to the Venetian Gentleman's Poker Room (877-264-1347) and ask to borrow their "house coat" for a couple hours. 'Cause ya gotta wear a coat if you want to bark like the Big Dogs.

Topic.Title: Everybody [many at least] speaks so well of this company.. but the stock does nothing

Message.Msg: "Those few tech giants that have "arrived" have done it thru True Innovation. And have provided the world with something truly unique and valuable that no one else has. Qualcomm did it by inventing and patenting the world's wireless protocols. And now derives income, either directly or indirectly, on Each and Every wireless device manufactured on the planet." So as more and more devices go wireless, QUALCOMM will earn more and more wireless patent licensing profits, right? What a beautiful business model indeed!
